block.name: Funcube Dongle Source
block.make: fcd.source_c($device_name) #if $freq() > 0 self.$(id).set_freq($freq) #end if #if $ppm() != 115 self.$(id).set_freq_corr($ppm) #end if #if ($dci() != 1.0) or ($dcq() != 1.0) self.$(id).set_dc_corr($dci,$dcq) #end if #if ($phase() != 0.0) or ($gain() != 1.0) self.$(id).set_iq_corr($phase,$gain) #end if
block.doc:
This block wraps the Funcube Dongle USB audio input and the USB HID control interface \ into one convenient GNU Radio source block.
The sample rate is fixed at 96 ksps.
To find the device name on Linux type: cat /proc/asound/cards
If you don't kow what value to use for frequency correction, try: - For FCD v1.0 you can leave at 115 - For FCD v1.1 with serial number 810 or greater use 12 ppm
The DC offset and IQ balance parameters can have range -1.0 to 1.0.
